To Supplier Company: PRIVACY NOTICE: Red Hat will process, store, and in general manage personal information contained in this Questionnaire for purposes of assessing your Company and its personnel and resources in connection with our relationship with your Company. Red Hat's general privacy practices that apply to personal information Red Hat collects, uses and shares are described in Red Hat’s Privacy Statement at: https://www.redhat.com/en/about/privacy-policy In order to comply with the US Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and other applicable anti-corruption laws, Red Hat may use its parent company, IBM, and certain suppliers, including but not limited to Moody's Analytics, to conduct adverse media checks and other reviews to determine if your Company or its personnel and other resources have violated any laws or regulations. IBM’s Privacy Statement can be found at: http://www.ibm.com/privacy/us/en. The Bureau van Dijk (a Moody's Analytics company) privacy statement is available here: https://www.bvdinfo.com/en-gb/product-privacy-policy Certification Statements: By completing and submitting this Supplier Questionnaire, you and your Company further certify: 1. That all information and answers you have furnished in this Supplier Questionnaire are truthful, accurate, and complete, and your Company will report to Red Hat promptly any changes in the information provided. 2. You acknowledge that have read and agree to the terms of the Red Hat Supplier Code of Conduct available at: https://www.redhat.com/en/about/policies/procurement/supplier-code-of-conduct 3. You certify that your Company will complete an integrity training and integrity questionnaires when requested. 4. You guarantee that you have provided the required notices identified above to all persons referenced herein. 5. Your company is responsible for safeguarding the Ariba Account Credentials, and that only authorized personnel are allowed to use them. Definitions: As used in this Supplier Questionnaire, the term: “Board Members” includes all of the members of a company’s Board of Directors or any equivalent or comparable governing body or group. “Company” includes any company, corporation, partnership, limited liability company or other entity. It also includes Organizations as Universities, Landlords as well as Freelancers. “Government” includes any (a) national, state or local government, (b) public international organization (such as the United Nations), (c) agency or company subject to a country's public procurement laws and (d) company that is owned or controlled by a government, organization, agency or company described in items (a), (b), (c) or (d) of this definition (such as a state-owned oil or telephone company). “Senior Management” includes (a) all of a company’s officers, presidents, senior vice presidents, managing directors, directors of sales, finance and marketing and all members of a company’s senior leadership teams, (b) if a company does not have “officers”, “presidents”, “senior vice presidents”, “managing directors”, or “directors of sales, finance or marketing”, then those persons holding equivalent or comparable positions to those and (c) those persons (other than administrative personnel, such as secretarial assistants) who report to the positions / persons covered by items (a) and (b). ”Ultimate Parent” is the top-level company in a family of companies. An Ultimate Parent directly or indirectly controls a company. In the following example, Company D is Company A’s Ultimate Parent: - Company A is controlled by Company B; - Company B is controlled by Company C; - Company C is controlled by Company D; and - No Certification Statements:
By completing and submitting this Supplier Questionnaire, you and your Company further certify:
  1. That all information and answers you have furnished in this Supplier Questionnaire are truthful, accurate, and complete, and your Company will report to Red Hat promptly any changes in the information provided.

  4. You guarantee that you have provided the required notices identified above to all persons referenced herein.
  5. Your company is responsible for safeguarding the Ariba Account Credentials, and that only authorized personnel are allowed to use them. Hat Basic Assessment Questionnaire,String,Requirement,"All the information requested below is necessary for Qualifying your company as Red Hat Supplier, and for as long as it remains a Red Hat Privacy Policy To Supplier Company: PRIVACY NOTICE: Red Hat will process, store, and in general manage personal information contained in this Questionnaire for purposes of assessing your Company and its personnel and resources in connection with our relationship with your Company; In order to comply with the US Foreign Corrupt Practices, Act and other applicable anti-corruption laws, Red Hat may use suppliers to conduct the adverse media checks and other reviews to determine if your Company or its personnel and other resources have not violated any laws or regulations. The Bureau van Dijk (a Moody's Analytics company) privacy statement is available here : https://www.bvdinfo.com/en-gb/product-privacy-policy Red Hat's general privacy practices that apply to personal information Red Hat collects, uses and shares are described in Red Hat’s Privacy Statement at: https://www.redhat.com/en/about/privacy-policy Certification Statements: By completing and submitting this Supplier Questionnaire, you and your Company further certify: 1. That all information and answers you have furnished in this Supplier Questionnaire are truthful, accurate, and complete, and your Company will report to Red Hat promptly any changes in the information provided. 2. You acknowledge that have read and agree to the terms of the Red Hat Supplier Code of Conduct available at: https://www.redhat.com/en/about/policies/procurement/supplier-code-of-conduct 3. You certify that your Company will complete an integrity training and integrity questionnaires when requested. 4. You guarantee that you have provided the required notices identified above to all persons referenced herein. 5. Your company is responsible for safeguarding the Ariba Account Credentials, and that only authorized personnel are allowed to use them. Definitions: As used in this Supplier Questionnaire, the term: “Board Members” includes all of the members of a company’s Board of Directors or any equivalent or comparable governing body or group. “Company” includes any company, corporation, partnership, limited liability company or other entity. It also includes Organizations as Universities, Landlords as well as Freelancers. “Government” includes any (a) national, state or local government, (b) public international organization (such as the United Nations), (c) agency or company subject to a country's public procurement laws and (d) company that is owned or controlled by a government, organization, agency or company described in items (a), (b), (c) or (d) of this definition (such as a state-owned oil or telephone company). “Senior Management” includes (a) all of a company’s officers, presidents, senior vice presidents, managing directors, directors of sales, finance and marketing and all members of a company’s senior leadership teams, (b) if a company does not have “officers”, “presidents”, “senior vice presidents”, “managing directors”, or “directors of sales, finance or marketing”, then those persons holding equivalent or comparable positions to those and (c) those persons (other than administrative personnel, such as secretarial assistants) who report to the positions / persons covered by items (a) and (b). ”Ultimate Parent” is the top-level company in a family of companies. An Ultimate Parent directly or indirectly controls a company. In the following example, Company D is Company A’s Ultimate Parent: - Company A is controlled by Company B; - Company B is controlled by Company C; - Company C is controlled by Company D; and - No company controls Company D. “English Language” – is using the basic Latin Alphabet character set (A-Z) “Local Language” and “Na",100,1 Definitions: As used in this Supplier Questionnaire, the term: “Board Members” includes all of the members of a company’s Board of Directors or any equivalent or comparable governing body or group. “Company” includes any company, corporation, partnership, limited liability company or other entity. It also includes Organizations as Universities, Landlords as well as Freelancers. “Government” includes any (a) national, state or local government, (b) public international organization (such as the United Nations), (c) agency or company subject to a country's public procurement laws and (d) company that is owned or controlled by a government, organization, agency or company described in items (a), (b), (c) or (d) of this definition (such as a state-owned oil or telephone company). “Senior Management” includes (a) all of a company’s officers, presidents, senior vice presidents, managing directors, directors of sales, finance and marketing and all members of a company’s senior leadership teams, (b) if a company does not have “officers”, “presidents”, “senior vice presidents”, “managing directors”, or “directors of sales, finance or marketing”, then those persons holding equivalent or comparable positions to those and (c) those persons (other than administrative personnel, such as secretarial assistants) who report to the positions / persons covered by items (a) and (b). ”Ultimate Parent” is the top-level company in a family of companies. An Ultimate Parent directly or indirectly controls a company.
